metadata.title: CVE-2014-3669 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the object_custom function inext/standard/var_unserializer.c in PHP before 5.4.34, 5.5.x before 5.5.18,and 5.6.x before 5.6.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via an argument tothe unserialize function that triggers calculation of a large length value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.5').
